title: Tenses
introduction: Tenses are verb forms that indicate when an action takes place. There are three main tenses: Present, Past, and Future, each with four subcategories.

content.value: Simple Present (Verb + s)
Used for current actions.
Example: She writes a book. He plays cricket.
Present Continuous (am/is/are + verb + ing)
Indicates an action that is ongoing at the present time.
Example: She is writing a book.
Present Perfect (has/have + past participle)
Used when the action started in the past but continues or has consequences in the present.
Example: She has written a book.
Present Perfect Continuous (has/have + been + verb + ing)
Used when the action started in the past and is still ongoing.
Example: She has been writing a book for two hours.
Simple Past
Indicates an action that ended in the past. Example: She wrote a book.
Past Continuous
Describes an action that was ongoing in the past. Example: She was writing a book.
Past Perfect
Used when an action was completed before another past action. Example: She had written a book before lunch.
Past Perfect Continuous
Indicates an action that was ongoing until another past action occurred. Example: She had been writing a book for two hours before lunch.
Simple Future (will/shall + verb)
Used for actions that will occur in the future. Example: She will write a book.
Future Continuous (will/shall + be + verb + ing)
Describes an action that will be ongoing in the future. Example: She will be writing a book.
Future Perfect (will + have + past participle)
Used when an action will be completed before a specific future time. Example: She will have written a book by tomorrow.
Future Perfect Continuous (will + have + been + verb + ing)
Indicates an action that will be ongoing until a specific future time. Example: She will have been writing a book for two hours by then.

exercises.title: Identify the Tense
exercises.instructions: Identify the tense used in each of the following sentences.

questions.question: She writes a letter every day.
They are watching a movie right now.
We had completed the project before the deadline.

exercises.title: Fill in the Blanks
exercises.instructions: Fill in the blanks with the correct form of the verb in the specified tense.

questions.question: By next year, she __________ (complete, Future Perfect) her degree.
I __________ (work, Present Perfect Continuous) on this project for three months.
They __________ (travel, Past Continuous) when the storm started.
